--stepson | family = | website = }} '''Fayez Sarofim''' ({{lang-arz|فايز صاروفيم}}) (born 1929) is a [[Coptic American]] heir to the [[Sarofim family]] fortune, fund manager for a number of [[Dreyfus family]] stock funds, an original and second largest shareholder of [[Kinder Morgan]] (NYSE: KMI) and part owner of the [[NFL]] team [[Houston Texans]]; ranked 5th Most Valuable [[NFL]] team worth $1.85 billion.[https://www.forbes.com/nfl-valuations/ Forbes NFL Valuation] August 2015 He is divorced with five children, and lives in [[Houston]], [[Texas]]. With an estimated {{As of|2015|alt=current}} net worth of $1.91 billion, Sarofim is ranked by ''[[Forbes]]'' as the [[List of billionaires|847-richest person in the world]], in 2015. His investment firms oversee over $30 billion in assets. == Early life == Fayez Shalaby Sarofim was born in 1929 in [[Cairo]], into Egyptian [[nobility]]. As the son of an Egyptian aristocrat and agricultural [[magnate]], Sarofim lived a life among Egypt's political and wealthy elite, in modern [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]]. As a [[Bey]] (equivalent to European [[peerage]] title [[Marquess]]){{citation-needed|date=November 2018}}, Sarofim's father held large feudal and Egyptian cotton estates throughout North Africa. Sarofim came to the United States in 1946 and became a naturalized American citizen in 1961. After, earning degrees from the [[University of California Berkeley]], and [[Harvard Business School]], Sarofim took a job with cotton company [[Anderson, Clayton and Company]] in Houston.[http://www.texasmonthly.com/content/cant-buy-me-love Texas Monthly: "Can’t Buy Me Love" by Skip Hollandsworth] October 2000 ==Career== In August 1958, he founded Fayez Sarofim & Company, a Houston [[investment firm]]. In 1997, he was inducted into the Texas Business Hall of Fame. Sarofim is ranked third on the most influential Egyptian Americans. The Sarofim family is recorded in [[Burke's Peerage]] and the 'Imperial and Asiatic quarterly review and oriental and colonial record'.{{Citation needed|date=September 2017}} ==Philanthropy and political donations== His philanthropic efforts provide vital assistance to critical institutions and programs in a number of fields. Sarofim is a major contributor to the [[Houston Ballet]] and the Museum of Fine Arts, a favorite of his daughter Allison. He has provided support to [[Memorial Sloan–Kettering Cancer Center]], the Texas Children’s Hospital and the [[University of Texas Health Science Center]] at Houston for construction of the $120 Million environment friendly, Fayez S. Sarofim Research Building. Sarofim also has made financial gifts to the [[Houston Grand Opera]], the [[Houston Symphony]], donating high seven figures to the [[Hobby Center for the Performing Arts]], creating the 2600 seat, Sarofim Hall, designed for touring Broadway shows, [[the Alley Theatre]], and the [[Los Angeles Opera]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2017}} Sarofim was a major supporter of [[Jeb Bush]]'s 2016 presidential candidacy.{{cite news|last1=O'Keefe|first1=Ed|title=George H. W. Bush, Barbara Bush to attend Houston fundraiser for Jeb Bush|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2015/03/24/george-h-w-bush-barbara-bush-to-attend-houston-fundraiser-for-jeb-bush/|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Washington Post|date=24 March 2015}} ==Personal life== Sarofim has been married three times. In 1962, he married Louisa Stude, adopted daughter of Herman Brown, founder of [[Brown and Root]]; they had two children: [[Christopher Sarofim]] and Allison Sarofim. In 1984, he had a son, Andrew Sarofim, with Linda Hicks, a former employee at his company. In 1986, they had another son, Phillip Sarofim; and in 1989, she had another child with a different father whom Sarofim adopted. In 1990, he divorced his first wife who received a $250 million divorce settlement. In 1990, he married Hicks; in 1996, they divorced with Hicks receiving a $12 million settlement. Hicks later died while climbing [[Mount Kilimanjaro]]. In December 2014, he married Susan Krohn, the ex-wife of fellow billionaire [[Tracy Krohn]], and mother of his son Phillip's wife Lori Krohn.[http://houston.culturemap.com/news/society/01-06-15-houston-billionaire-weds-sons-mother-in-law-at-his-hawaii-retreat-with-lavish-new-year-luau/ Houston Culture: "Houston billionaire weds son's mother-in-law at his Hawaii retreat with lavish New Year luau" By Shelby Hodge] January 15, 2015[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2697397/Texas-billionaire-85-set-marry-sons-mother-law.html Daily Mail: "Texas billionaire, 85, set to marry his son's mother-in-law 'after being introduced by their children'" by Joel Christie] July 18, 2014 ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sarofim, Fayez}} [[Category:1929 births]] [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:American money managers]] [[Category:American people of Coptic descent]] [[Category:Coptic Christians from the United States]] [[Category:Egyptian businesspeople]] [[Category:Egyptian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Copts]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley alumni]] [[Category:Coptic billionaires]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Stock and commodity market managers]] [[Category:Egyptian billionaires]] [[Category:Coptic Orthodox Christians from Egypt]] [[Category:Harvard Business School alumni]]

Scott Showalter]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fasab.gov/board-members/|title=Board Members|website=www.fasab.gov}}</ref> |chief1_position = Chairman |chief2_name = [[Wendy Payne]] |chief2_position = Executive Director |parent_agency = |child1_agency = |child2_agency = |website = {{url|http://www.fasab.gov}} |footnotes = }}
The '''Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board''' ('''FASAB''') is a United States federal advisory committee whose mission is to improve federal financial reporting through issuing federal financial accounting standards and providing guidance after considering the needs of external and internal users of federal financial information.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fasab.gov/mission-objectives/|title=Mission|website=fasab.gov}}</ref> FASAB is designated as the body that sets [[U.S. generally accepted accounting principles]] (GAAP) for the United States Government and its component entities, referred to as federal financial reporting entities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fasab.gov/the-history-of-fasab/#designation|title=History of FASAB|website=fasab.gov}}</ref> The [[AICPA]] Council designated FASAB as the body that establishes GAAP for federal entities in 1999.<ref>http://www.aicpa.org/Research/Standards/CodeofConduct/DownloadableDocuments/2014December15ContentAsof2016August31CodeofConduct.pdf section 1.320.020 paragraph .03</ref>
The [[Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990]] required annual, audited financial statements for the United States Government and its federal reporting entities. In order to apply the statutes of the CFO Act of 1990, the [[United States Secretary of the Treasury|Secretary of the Treasury]], the Director of the [[United States Office of Management and Budget|Office of Management and Budget]] (OMB), and the [[Comptroller General of the United States|Comptroller General]] established FASAB to develop the "applicable accounting principles" for the newly required financial statements.
FASAB issues the Statement of Federal Financial Accounting Standards (SFFAS), Interpretations, Technical Bulletins, Technical Releases, and Staff Implementation Guidance.<ref>{{cite book|chapterurl=http://files.fasab.gov/pdffiles/handbook_foreword.pdf|title=FASAB Handbook of Federal Accounting Standards and Other Pronouncements|chapter=Foreword}}</ref> FASAB standards are publicly available on its website--both by chapter and in the FASAB Handbook, which is updated annually.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fasab.gov/accounting-standards/|title=Standards & Guidance|website=fasab.gov}}</ref>

[[File:WLANL - Quistnix! - Havenmuseum - Figee walkraan (1927).jpg|thumb|Crane by Figee, now at the [[Haven Museum]], [[Rotterdam]].]] '''Hendrik Figee''' ([[Haarlem]], May 28, 1838 – [[Haarlem]], December 3, 1907) was a Dutch businessman and entrepreneur creditted with growing the Haarlem factory [[Figee]] into an international manufacturer of [[crane (machine)|crane]]s.
==Biography== [[File:Spaarne - zicht naar het noorden vanaf brug.jpg|thumb|left|View of old Figee factory (center) on the [[Spaarne]] river, now converted to office space. On the left is the harbor master's office of Haarlem, and on the right is the old [[Droste factory]] building.]] He was the son of Hendrik Figee the elder who attended grade school and later became a surveyor. After passing his surveyor's exam, he went to work for his father in his steam engine factory on the Spaarne river. In 1866 he became full partner along with his brother Thomas and the company name changed to Gebroeders Figee (Figee brothers).<ref name=NNBW>[http://www.historici.nl/retroboeken/nnbw/#source=2&page=227 Hendrik Figee] biography in the [[NNBW]]</ref> He also helped start the crane manufacturing company Figee & De Kruyff in Amsterdam and the ironworks called the Haarlems IJzergieterij. In 1883 his brother Thomas bought the shipbuilding company Conrad on the other side of the Spaarne river. Werf Conrad had been named after the renowned Dutch engineer [[Frederik Willem Conrad]] (1800-1870). Figee wanted to make dredgers (baggermolens).<ref>[http://www.beeldbank.noord-hollandsarchief.nl/memorix/404be2c0-fb8f-11df-9e4d-523bc2e286e2 picture of Conrad dredger being let into the water] in 1910 on North Holland Archives</ref> The dredgers needed cranes on board, and these were supplied by Figee, which became a specialist in building cranes.<ref>[http://www.havenmuseum.nl/het-museum.collectieobject&cat_id=5&col_id=5 Crane]{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} in the [[Haven Museum]], Rotterdam</ref> He was a member of the board of the [[Maatschappij voor Nijverheid en Handel, Haarlem]] from 1898-1902 and was also a member of the board of the Colonial Museum, formerly located in [[villa Welgelegen]].<ref name=NNBW/>

[[File:Johann Conrad Fischer 1773-1854.jpg|thumb|Johann Conrad Fischer 1854]]
'''Johann Conrad Fischer''' (14 September 1773 - 26 December 1854) was a Swiss [[metallurgist]], inventor, and pioneer in the [[steel industry]]. As an entrepreneur he also held public offices. He was the first president of the City Council of [[Schaffhausen]]. He was the founder of [[Georg Fischer AG]].
==Biography== Johann Conrad Fischer was born on 14 September 1773 as son of the entrepreneur Johann Conrad Fischer in Schaffhausen.<ref>Adrian Knoepfli. ''Vier Generationen Fischer Schaffhausen: Mit Eisen- und Stahlguss zum Erfolg''. Naefels: Verein fuer wirtschaftshistorische Studien, 2001. {{ISBN|3-909059-24-4}}</ref> After attending the ''Gymnasium'' in Schaffhausen, he learned the trades of coppersmith and [[fire pump]] maker in his father's company. Between 1792 and 1794 he travelled through Germany, Scandinavia and England. After his return to [[Switzerland]] in 1794 he took over the management of the family business in 1797. In 1802 he purchased several former mills in [[Muehlental (SH)]] section of the [[Merishausertal]] on the northern outskirts of Schaffhausen and set up a small [[foundry]] for the production of cast iron bells and fire pump engines. In 1806, as the first on continental Europe, he began to cast steel. Once the [[Continental Blockade]] was lifted in 1814, Fischer undertook a study trip to England and subsequently published his experiences in a travel journal. In particular he was critical of the economic upheavals he observed in the Midlands, the beginnings of the [[Industrial Revolution]]. He continued to travel through England, Austria, Germany and France. In France he was invited by the Ministry of the Interior to set up a business there. He began to experiment with the addition of alloys to cast steel. In 1807 he cast steel with [[manganese]], in 1814 he mixed so-called yellow steel with cooper, in 1819 with silver, and in 1823 with chromium. In 1827 he successfully created a cast iron which could be employed as [[malleable iron]] and obtained a patent in Austria for this invention. His last alloyed cast iron consisted to one-third part of copper, which he named ''Fischer-Metall''. This would be useful much later for railroad axials.
==Family== In 1797 Johann Conrad Fischer married Catharina von Waldkirch and they had three sons who carried on their father's work: *[[Georg Fischer (1804-1888)]] *[[Berthold Fischer (1807-1879)]] *[[Wilhelm Fischer (1803-1882)]] Johann Conrad Fischer died in Schaffhausen at the age of 81. His grandson [[Georg Fischer II (1834-1887)]] and great-grandson [[George Fischer III (1864-1925)]] continued to expand the family business until the beginning of the 20th century.
==Fischer as Entrepreneur and Civic Leader== Fischer was more active as an inventor than as manufacturer and businessman. In 1819 he supported the establishment of a steel factory near [[Montbeliard]] in eastern France. He held license agreements with manufacturing companies in London and Luettich. Due to its favorable legal conditions, he patented nearly all his inventions in Austria. Furthermore he set up three steel foundries in Austria which were managed by his sons: 1827 in Hainfeld, 1833 in Traisen and 1839 in Salzburg.
Johann Conrad Fischer held several public offices in Schaffhausen beginning in 1797. His opinion was often sought by newspapers and journalists in matters related to railroads, coinage, import and export taxation, as well as constitutional matters. He maintained regular correspondence with many friends not only in Switzerland, but also in numerous other European countries. Fischer is regarded as one of the leading public figures of Schaffhausen in the 19th century.
==Further reading== *''The Metallurgist Johann Conrad Fischer 1773-1854, and His Relations with Britain''. Schaffhausen, Switzerland: George Fischer Limited, 1947. *W. O. Henderson. ''Johann Conrad Fischer and His Diary of Industrial England. 1814-1851.'' London: Routledge, 2006.

'''John Blackie''' LLD DL (1805–1873) was a 19th century Scottish publisher and the "son" of '''[[Blackie and Son|Blackie & Son]]''' who served as [[List of provosts of Glasgow|Lord Provost of Glasgow]] from 1863 to 1866.
The company specialised in printing annotated [[bible]]s and religious works including Scotland's firsrt religious newspaper, the '''Scottish Guardian'''.
==Life== [[File:42 BUTE GARDENS, LILYBANK HOUSE.jpg|thumb|300px|Lilybank House in Glasgow]]
He was born near [[Glasgow]] on 27 September 1805 the eldest of eight children of John Blackie (1782-1874) and his wife, Catherine Duncan. He was educated at William Angus's English School on Ingram Street then at the Glasgow High School.<ref>Glasgow Post Office Directory 1810.</ref>
Around 1830 the family moved to [[Glasgow]] where his father was partner in Blackie, Fullarton & Co at 8 East Clyde Street on the north side of the [[River Clyde]]. The family then lived at 18 Monteith Row.<ref>Glasgow Post Office Directory 1830.</ref> In 1831 following the death of Fullarton the company renamed as '''Blackie & Son''' but still operated from 8 Clyde Street. In 1837 a sister company was set up by John's younger brother, Walter Graham Blackie (1816-1906), and named '''W. G. Blackie & Co''', which existed cocurrently with but separate from Blackie & Son.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gracesguide.co.uk/Blackie_and_Son|title=Blackie and Son|publisher=Grace's Guide|accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref>
In 1857 Blackie joined Glasgow town council as a Liberal councillor. He became burgh magistrate in 1859. In 1863 he was elected [[Lord Provost]] and served for three years, succeeding to [[Peter Clouston]]. His main acievement in this role was in the instigation and implementation of Glasgow's City Improvement Act of 1865 which began a programme of slum clearance and rebuilding. A fresh water supply from [[Loch Katrine]] was also agreed and implemented.<ref>[http://www.glasgowwestaddress.co.uk/100_Glasgow_Men/Blackie_John.htm John Blackie] Retrieved 2 July 2018.</ref>
John died of [[pleurisy]] on 12 February 1873 at his home Lilybank House in the [[Hillhead]] district.<ref>Glasgow Post Office Directory 1873.</ref>
At the death of John Blackie senior in 1874 (outliving his son) the company passed to various of his grandsons and the company was rebranded as '''Blackie & Co Ltd'''.
==Family== In 1849 he married Agnes Gourlay daughter of William Gourlay, a Glasgow merchant of 8 South Frederick Street.<ref>Glasgow Post Office Directory 1849.</ref>
They had three sons who later rebranded the company as '''Blackie & Co'''.
==Artistic Recognition== Blackie's photograph, by [[David Octavius Hill]] is held by the [[Scottish National Portrait Gallery]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nationalgalleries.org/art-and-artists/9364/john-blackie-1805-1873-glasgow-publisher-b|author1=Robert Adamson|author2=David Octavius Hill|title=John Blackie, 1805 - 1873. Of Glasgow; publisher|accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref>

'''Kiss up kick down''' (or '''suck up kick down''') is a [[neologism]] used to describe the situation where middle level employees in an organization are polite and [[flattering]] to superiors but [[abusive supervision|abusive to subordinates]].<ref name=Paton1>[http://www.midstaffspublicinquiry.com/sites/default/files/transcripts/Tuesday_21_June_2011_-_transcript.pdf Mid Staffordshire Public Inquiry Transcript - day 103 - 21 June 2011]</ref> It is believed to have originated in the US, with the first documented use having occurred in 1993. The concept can be applied to any social interaction where one person believes they have power over another person and believes that another person has power over them.<ref name=Paton2>Calum Paton The Policy of NHS Deficits and NHS Re-form in Health Policy and Politics 2007</ref><ref name=McNamara>JJ Mearsheimer, D Shapley [http://mearsheimer.uchicago.edu/pdfs/A0020x1.pdf MCNAMARA'S WAR] Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, 00963402, Jul/Aug93, Vol.49, Issue 6</ref>
== Examples of use == ===Robert McNamara=== The ''Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists'' described [[Robert McNamara]], an American business executive and the eighth [[United States Secretary of Defense]], as a classic case of the ''kiss up, kick down'' personality in August 1993.<ref name=McNamara/>
===John R. Bolton=== On day 2 of the Senate confirmation hearings, April 12, 2005, for [[John R. Bolton]], a [[George W. Bush|Bush]] nomination for the US representative to the UN, the Senate panel focused on allegations that Bolton pressured intelligence analysts. Former State Department intelligence chief [[Carl Ford|Carl W. Ford Jr.]] characterized Bolton as a "''kiss-up, kick-down'' sort of guy", implying that he was always ready to please whoever had authority over him, while having very little regard for people working under him.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/washington/2005-04-12-bolton_x.htm | work=USA Today | title=Critic says Bolton a 'kiss-up, kick-down sort of guy' | first1=Barbara | last1=Slavin | date=April 12, 2005 }}</ref>
===National Health Service=== Calum Paton, Professor of Health Policy at [[Keele University]], describes ''kiss up kick down'' as a prevalent feature of the UK [[National Health Service]] culture. He raised this point when giving evidence at the [[Stafford_Hospital_scandal#Public_inquiry|Stafford Hospital scandal public inquiry]]. Credit is centralised and blame devolved. "''Kiss up kick down'' means that your middle level people will ''kiss-up'', they will please their masters, political or otherwise, and they will ''kick down'' to blame somebody else when things go wrong." <ref name=Paton1/><ref>[[Robert Francis (barrister)|Robert Francis]] (Nov 29, 2011) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dwnVE4GPbhs Organisational Culture seminar: opening statement]</ref>
For example, NHS Trust bosses are nervous of reporting deficits and seek to under-report until it's too late. They seek to please their political superiors in the short term and shift blame down the line.<ref name=Paton2/>
==Blame in organizations== Some [[systems theory|systems theorists]] and [[management consultant]]s, such as [[Gerald Weinberg]], see the flow of [[blame]] in an [[organization]] as one of the most important indicators of that organization's robustness and integrity. Blame flowing downwards, from management to staff, or laterally between professionals, indicates organizational failure. In a blame culture, problem-solving is replaced by blame-avoidance. Weinberg emphasizes that blame coming from the top generates "fear, malaise, errors, accidents, and [[passive-aggressive]] responses from the bottom", with those at the bottom feeling powerless and lacking emotional safety.<ref name=Weinberg>Gerald M. Weinberg (March 5, 2006) [http://www.ayeconference.com/beyondblaming/ ''Beyond Blaming''], AYE Conference</ref>
===Kick up kiss down=== ''Kick up kiss-down'' has been suggested as a viable more healthy dynamic.<ref>Harvey Schachter (Jul. 25 2011) [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/careers/management/kicking-up-kissing-down/article616182/ Kicking up, kissing down] The Globe and Mail</ref> Blame flowing upwards in a hierarchy, Weinberg argues, proves that superiors can take [[moral responsibility|responsibility]] for their orders to their inferiors, and supply them with the resources required to do their jobs.<ref name=Weinberg/>
==In workplace bullying== {{Main|Workplace bullying}} The workplace bully is often expert at knowing how to work the system. They can spout all the current management buzzwords about supportive management but basically use it as a cover. By keeping their [[abusive]] behavior hidden, any charges made by individuals about his or her bullying will always come down to your word against the bully's. They may have a ''kiss up kick down'' personality, wherein they are always highly cooperative, respectful, and caring when talking to upper management but the opposite when it comes to their relationship with those whom they supervise.<ref>Petrecca, L. (December 27 2010) Bullying by the boss is common but hard to fix. ''USA Today'' </ref> Bullies tend to [[ingratiate]] themselves to their bosses while [[intimidating]] subordinates.<ref>(15 Oct 2010) [http://www.aftlocal1904.org/bully_workshop.pdf How to manage a bully boss - Council of NJ State College Locals, AFT]</ref><ref> Mary Donohue (2 Oct 2013) [http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/mary-donohue/bad-managers_b_4017881.html Fighting Back Against the Tyranny of the Manager] The Huffington Post Csnada</ref> The bully may be socially popular with others in management, including those who will determine the bully's fate. Often, a workplace bully will have mastered ''kiss up kick down'' tactics that hide their abusive side from superiors who review their performance.<ref> DC Yamada (2008) Workplace bullying and ethical leadership - Journal of Values-Based Leadership, Vol. 1, No. 2, p. 49</ref>
As a consequence of this ''kiss up kick down'' strategy:<ref>Robert Killoren (2014) The Toll of Workplace Bullying - Research Management Review, Volume 20, Number 1</ref> * a bully’s mistakes are always concealed or blamed on underlings or circumstances beyond their control * a bully keeps the target under constant [[Occupational stress|stress]] * a bully’s power base is fear, not respect * a bully withholds information from subordinates and keeps the information flow top-down only * a bully blames [[Workplace conflict|conflicts]] and problems on subordinate’s lack of competence, poor attitude, and/or character flaws * a bully creates an unnatural work environment where people constantly walk on eggshells and are compelled to behave in ways they normally would not.
==See also== {{columns-list|colwidth=20em| * [[Abuse]] * [[Abusive power and control]] * [[Bullying culture]] * [[Culture of fear]] * [[Fit in or fuck off]] * [[Kick the cat]] * [[Machiavellianism in the workplace]] * [[Managing up and managing down]] * [[Narcissism in the workplace]] * [[Occupational health psychology]] * [[Petty tyranny]] * [[Psychopathy in the workplace]] * [[Scapegoating]] * [[Toxic workplace]] }}

Career Management] * Max McKeown Apr 22, 2005 [http://www.management-issues.com/opinion/2071/kissing-up-kicking-down/ Kissing up, kicking down] Management Issues

Gabriel | party = [[Christian Liberal Party of Ukraine]] | website = [http://www.chernovetskiy.com.ua/ www.chernovetskiy.com.ua/] | signature = Leonid Chernovetskyi Signature 2008.png | religion = }} '''Leonid Mykhaylovych Chernovetskyi''' ({{lang-uk|Леонід Михайлович Черновецький}}; born November 25, 1951 in [[Kharkiv]], [[Ukrainian SSR]]) is a former [[Mayor of Kiev]], the [[capital (city)|capital]] of [[Ukraine]], from 2006 until the summer of 2012. He was a successful businessman, founder and controlling stakeholder of the Pravex Group and [[Pravex Bank]], one of the largest banks in Ukraine. Since the appointment by [[Ukrainian President|President]] [[Viktor Yanukovych]] of [[Oleksandr Popov]] as Head of Kiev City State Administration on 16 November 2010, replacing Chernovetskyi, Chernovetskyi was deprived of any real decision-making role in Kiev.[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/96079/ Popov: Activity of city council and city head limited], [[Kyiv Post]] (February 1, 2011)[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/city/detail/90367/ Party of Regions leader: 'Pre-term mayoral elections in Kyiv are pointless'], [[Kyiv Post]] (November 18, 2011) He tendered his resignation on 1 June 2012. After this resignation Chernovetsky and his family moved to the [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]n town [[Kobuleti]] and he has [[Georgian citizenship]][Georgia not to extradite ex-mayor of Kyiv Chernovetsky to Ukraine https://www.kyivpost.com/ukraine-politics/georgia-not-extradite-ex-mayor-kyiv-chernovetsky-ukraine.html], [[Kyiv Post]] (26 July 2017) ==Early life== Chernovetskyi quit school when he was 14 and went to work as a [[Machinist|fitter]] at an aviation factory, but soon returned to resume his education, graduating from the Kharkiv public school #4. From 1970 until 1972, Chernovetsky served his military obligations. In 1977, he graduated from the Kharkiv Law School (Харьковский юридический институт) with specialization in [[jurisprudence]]. He worked as the senior detective in the prosecutor's office of [[Kiev Oblast]]. In 1981, he returned to Kharkiv Law School attending [[aspirantura]] and obtained his [[doctorate]] in 1984 with a dissertation about ''Methods of investigation of plunders conducted by officials''. Until 1989 he was a teacher at [[Kiev University]]. == Career == Soon after [[perestroika]], he went into private business, becoming one of the earliest big businesspeople in Kiev. He founded the Pravex Group ({{lang-uk|Правекс}}, an abbreviated from "Law, Economics and Sociology"). Later the banking division of the Pravex Group rose into the [[Pravex Bank]] - one of the largest banks in Ukraine, possessing a dense network of offices in Kiev and other regions.{{Cite web|url = http://www.pravex.com/rus/main|title = ПРАВЭКС-БАНК — Главная страница|website = www.pravex.com|access-date = 2016-03-02}} In 2001, Chernovestkyi and his bank founded the "[[Kiev Bank Union]]" banking association. Pravex Bank was sold in 2008 to Banca Intesa São Paulo for 509 million euros. Chernovetskyi has acknowledged giving millions in bribes during his days as a businessman. In 2012, Leonid Chernovetskiy founded the Chernovetskyi Investment Group, a venture capital group based in Kiev.{{Cite web|url = https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/chernovetsky-investment-group#/entity|title = Chernovetskyi Investment Group {{!}} CrunchBase|website = www.crunchbase.com|access-date = 2016-03-02}} In 2015, the Chernovetskyi Investment Group made an investment of $1 million into Busfor, a Moscow-based online tour company.{{Cite web|url = http://chernovetskyiinvestments.com/en/information/77-chernovetskyi-investment-group-investrovala-1-mln-v-mezhdunarodnyj-servis-po-prodazhe-avtobusnyh-biletov-busfor|title = Chernovetskyi Investment Group -|website = chernovetskyiinvestments.com|access-date = 2016-03-02|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304194506/http://chernovetskyiinvestments.com/en/information/77-chernovetskyi-investment-group-investrovala-1-mln-v-mezhdunarodnyj-servis-po-prodazhe-avtobusnyh-biletov-busfor|archivedate = 2016-03-04|df = }}{{Cite web|url = https://www.crunchbase.com/funding-round/fae6fa3bfbc3ea185282445e685053dc|title = Sep 9, 2015: Busfor - Funding RoundConvertible Note {{!}} CrunchBase|website = www.crunchbase.com|access-date = 2016-03-02}} On August 18, 2008 President [[Victor Yushchenko]] granted him the [[Order of Yaroslav the Wise]], though it was harshly opposed by Prime Minister [[Yulia Tymoshenko]] who urged to "stop granting decorations to corruptionists".{{cite news| url=http://palm.newsru.ua/ukraine/22aug2008/orden.html| title=БЮТ рекомендує президентові забрати орден у Черновецького| date=August 22, 2008| publisher=NEWSru.ua| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090821004309/http://palm.newsru.ua/ukraine/22aug2008/orden.html| archivedate=August 21, 2009| df=}} Chernovestkyi is a member of the [[Embassy of God]], an [[Evangelicalism|evangelical church]] founded by Nigerian immigrant [[Sunday Adelaja]].{{cite news| url=http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/10885/| title=Tymoshenko attended Embassy of God church, says Kyiv mayor | date=26 March 2009| newspaper=Interfax-Ukraine}} He is also a longtime [[philanthropist]] of Kiev, caring for the city's old and poor. In January 2009 Chernovitskyi bought [[FC Arsenal Kyiv]] for 1 [[Hryvnia]] from Ukrainian businessman [[Vadim Rabinovich]].[http://www.kyivpost.com/city/33683 Mayor to buy Arsenal football club], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 January 2009)[http://football.ua/ukraine/news/56652/page3.html Рабинович: "У Черновецкого внутри большая любовь к спорту"], football.ua (16 January 2009) {{ru icon}} In February 2009 he released a [[compact disc]] with "popular songs of the 1980s" sung by him.[http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/7210/ Disc with 'heartbreaking songs' of the 1980s by Kyiv mayor to be released in a week], [[Interfax|Interfax-Ukraine]] (4 February 2009) In 2009 he became the man of the year according to Korrespondent magazine.[http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/news/leonid-chernoveckiy-%E2%80%93-lichnost-goda-po-versii-zhurnala-korrespondent/] Официальный сайт Черновецкого In January 2, 2013 Leonid Chernovetskiy founded Chernovetskyi Investment Group, investment potential of which exceeds 750 million dollars.[http://chernovetskyiinvestments.com/ru/about/who-we-are. Chernovetskyi Investment Group]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He is currently Honorary President of Chernovetskyi Investment Group.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=26217963&privcapId=223939539&previousCapId=223939539&previousTitle=Chernovetskyi%20Investment%20Group|title=Leonid Mykhailovych Chernovetskyi: Executive Profile & Biography - Bloomberg|website=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-03-28}} Chernovetskyi was nicknamed "Cosmos" ({{lang-uk|Космос}}) after he publicly announced that he intends to fly in outer space with his cat. However, that name got stuck with him later due to his non-ordinary administrative and political decisions and announcements that have been viewed as "bizarre".[http://www.kyivpost.com/gallery/album/697/photo/2/ Cartoon], [[Kyiv Post]] (June 4, 2010) He has sung at rallies and offered to auction off his kisses. That behavior prompted some officials to call for a medical examination into whether he is mentally healthy to govern the city. In response, Chernovetsky posed on March 18, 2009 in tight swimming trunks in front of scores of reporters to try to show he was both physically and mentally fit.[http://photo.unian.net/eng/themes/11943/ Photos: Statement of Leonid Chernovetsky for press], [[UNIAN]] (March 18, 2009) Chernovestkyi was the subject of several personal and political attacks when he took office as mayor of Kiev. Some were critical about his lack of experience and his authoritarianism. Others considered him off-balance or speculated that he has drug or alcohol problems. However, none of these accusations have been proven to date.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/08/15/world/europe/15kiev.html?ref=global-home|title=Is the Mayor Fit for Office? No Sure Answer|last=Levy|first=Clifford J.|date=14 August 2009|newspaper=The New York Times|accessdate=2009-08-15}} ==Controversies== Pravex Bank, one of the largest retail banks of Ukraine formerly controlled by Chernovestkyi and his family, was rumoured to submit its new employees to a polygraph test and to use coercive methods to recover impaired loans. However, the Bank came out to be one of the most profitable financial institutions in Ukraine despite strong competition from foreign-owned banks. In 2003, Chernovestkyi made headlines for his links to the deaths of two pedestrians who had died on separate occasions after being run over at high speed by cars linked to Chernovetsky on the road leading to his mansion in the elite Koncha Zaspa residential neighborhood. Chernovetsky, who is a collector of expensive souped-up automobiles, was behind the wheel in the second incident; his wife was a passenger in the first. Neither Chernovetsky nor his driver has been found guilty of any wrongdoing in connection with the incidents.{{cite news| url=http://www.kyivpost.com/nation/24142/| title= 'Kyiv gets first new mayor in decade'| newspaper=[[Kyiv Post]]| date=29 March 2006}} On February 16, 2010 the Kiev city administration denied reports that Chernovetskyi's daughter Khrystyna Chernovetska was robbed in [[France]] on February 15, 2010 after foreign media had reported that Chernovetska had [[euro|€]]4.5 million worth of jewels stolen in [[Paris]].{{cite news| url=http://www.france24.com/en/20100216-daughter-kiev-mayor-robbery-million-euros-jewels-paris-france-theft| title=Kiev mayor’s daughter robbed in Paris of 4.5 million euros in jewels| newspaper=[[France 24]]| date=February 16, 2010| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219080143/http://www.france24.com/en/20100216-daughter-kiev-mayor-robbery-million-euros-jewels-paris-france-theft| archivedate=February 19, 2010| df=}} In April 2011, Interpol issued an international arrest warrant for Chernovetskyi's son-in-law Viacheslav Suprunenko, a member of the Kiev city council's Chernovetskyi Bloc faction.{{cite news| url=http://un.ua/eng/article/326378.html| title=17 Deputies Quit Chernovetskyi Bloc Faction At Kyiv City Council| date=April 28, 2011| newspaper=Ukrainian News Agency}} According to ''[[Kyiv Post]]'', he was arrested in Italy in May 2011.{{cite news| url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/105231/print/| title=Runaway Kyiv city council deputy detained in Italy| date=May 25, 2011| newspaper=Kyiv Post|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111217232644/http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/105231/print/|archivedate=December 17, 2011}} Chernovetskyi's son, Stepan was arrested in Barcelona in July 2016 on charges of money laundering and fraud{{Cite web|url=https://www.occrp.org/en/daily/5480-spain-video-shows-arrest-of-former-kyiv-mayor-s-son|title=Spain: Video Shows Arrest of Former Kyiv Mayor’s Son|last=Castro|first=Daniela|website=www.occrp.org|language=en|access-date=2017-03-28}} despite his father's denials and threats of legal action against Spanish authorities.{{Cite news|url=https://www.kyivpost.com/article/content/world/ex-kyiv-mayor-fumes-over-spanish-media-report-that-his-son-arrested-in-catalonia-on-suspicion-of-money-laundering-418580.html|title=Former Kyiv mayor fumes over Spanish media report that his son arrested in Catalonia on suspicion of money laundering {{!}} KyivPost|date=2016-07-13|work=KyivPost|access-date=2017-03-28|language=en-US}} Leonid Chernovetskyi released a statement on his Facebook page announcing the release of his son in August 2016.{{Cite news|url=https://www.kyivpost.com/article/content/ukraine-politics/chernovetsky-says-his-son-stepan-released-in-spain-420922.html|title=Chernovetsky says his son Stepan released in Spain {{!}} KyivPost|date=2016-08-12|work=KyivPost|access-date=2017-03-28|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://ukropnews24.com/chernovetsky-said-that-his-son-stepan-was-released-from-custody-in-spain/|title=Chernovetsky said that his son Stepan was released from custody in Spain|date=2016-08-12|work=Ukrop News 24|access-date=2017-03-28|language=en-US}} ==Political career== Chernovetskyi is the leader of the [[Christian Liberal Party of Ukraine]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hlpu.org.ua/leader/ |title=Leader of the Christian-Liberal Party of Ukraine Leonid Mikhailovich Chernovetskiy |accessdate=2008-03-20 |work=[[Christian Liberal Party of Ukraine]] |language=Russian |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080224064607/http://www.hlpu.org.ua/leader/ |archivedate=2008-02-24 |deadurl=yes |df= }} He joined the party in 1996 and was elected to the Ukrainian Parliament, the [[Verkhovna Rada]], representing one of Kiev's constituencies. He was reelected in 1998 and 2002. During his last term (2002–2006) he was a member of the Committee of National Budget and head of the Committee of a Control of Budget Spending. He also was a member of the [[Our Ukraine (political party)|Our Ukraine]] fraction in Parliament. In 1998-1999 Chernovestkyi was a co-chair, and in 1999-2000 the chair of the "For Beautiful Ukraine" party. From 1997 to 2001 he was a member of the Economic Advisory Council to the [[President of Ukraine]]. While being a member of Verhovna Rada Leonid Chernovetskyi strongly supported people of Kiev in struggle for their rights against officials of Kyiv City State Administration. During this time his office helped thousands of Kyiv citizens. In some cases he personally sought positive resolutions.http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/news/intervyu-l-chernoveckogo-izdaniyu-segodnya-chast-2/ In 2003, he initiated the adoption of the law "On the protection of public morals", which govern the basic directions of state regulation of information products circulation which affect negatively on public morality. The law also imposed prohibition on the production and circulation of pornographic nature objects.[http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/news/leonid-chernoveckij-byl-avtorom-pervogo-ukrainskogo-zakona-o-zashhite-obshhestvennoj-morali/] Официальный сайт ;2004 presidential elections Chernovestkyi was a self-nominated candidate in the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2004|2004 presidential election]], believed to be one of the "technical candidates" whose true mission was to assist [[Viktor Yushchenko]]'s struggle for the presidency by placing additional representatives in electoral commissions. ;2006 parliamentary and mayor elections According to the Kiev city election commission, Chernovetskyi garnered 32 percent of the vote to win the election for mayor of Kiev. [[Vitali Klitschko]] placed second with 24 percent and incumbent [[Oleksandr Omelchenko]] placed third with 21 percent. Opponents say Chernovetskyi won because of a dirty campaign marred by bribing impoverished elderly voters with food; Chernovetsky has denied this.{{cite news| url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29899207/ns/world_news-europe/t/kievs-cosmic-mayor-draws-protests/| title=Kiev's 'cosmic' mayor draws protests. Residents angry at price hikes picket office of eccentric Speedo-wearer| date=2009-03-26}} Chernovetskyi was also elected to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] in the list of the [[Our Ukraine–People's Self-Defense Bloc|Our Ukraine]] Bloc, but had to reject the parliamentary seat. In first year after the election victory Chernovetskyi increased Kyiv budget in 5 times[http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/news/intervyu-l-chernoveckogo-izdaniyu-segodnya-chast-1/] Официальный сайт Leonid Chernovetskyi was developing anti-alcohol and anti-tobacco programs during time when he was mayor.[http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/news/centralnye-ulicy-osvobodyat-ot-vrednyx-privychek/] Официальный сайт ;2008 snap Kiev local election and political unrest Leonid Chernovetskyi won another term as Mayor of Kiev with 38% of the vote in the May 25, 2008 [[Kiev mayoral election, 2008|snap local election]], called on by the Verkhovna Rada in March 2008.{{cite news|first=Yan|last=Liang|title=Ukraine's Kiev mayor wins re-election|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-05/29/content_8272983.htm|work=www.chinaview.cn|publisher=[[Xinhua]]|date=May 29, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-16|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090218164400/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-05/29/content_8272983.htm|archivedate=February 18, 2009|df=}} Former deputy head of Leonid Chernovetsky's Block Alla Shlapak stated opinion, that because of humanitarian programs for pensioners, teachers, medics and other groups of society, Chernoverskiy can be considered the best mayor of Kyiv.[http://thekievtimes.ua/society/380576-chernoveckogo-nazvali-luchshim-merom-kieva.html Черновецкого назвали лучшим мэром Киева] While having a solid amount of money he always paid attention to socially unprotected people and outcasts. In 2010 he founded a charitable service “Social patrol”, which was delivering warm clothes, food, medical assistance and advising to homeless people.{{cite web |url=http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/category/charity/socpartnerstvo/social-patrol/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140618101026/http://chernovetskiy.com.ua/category/charity/socpartnerstvo/social-patrol/ |archivedate=2014-06-18 |df= }} Официальный сайт In 12 of April 2012, in Georgia L. Chernovetskiy established charitable fund “Social partnership”. The main projects of Social Partnership fund are:“Home care” (providing medicaments and medical assistance to those who are in need); “Family-type orphanage”; “Large family support”; “Gathering of clothes” (system for receiving and redistribution of clothes for people in need); “Food collecting program” (gathering of food for poor people).http://fsp.ge/ru/projects/ After the resignation from post of mayor he continued engage in charity. According to his own statement ex-mayor spends not less than 1 million dollars to charity per year. In September 2013 he has opened an orphanage in Georgia. Leonid Chernoverskiy belongs to those politics, who are active users of social networks. His Facebook page is updated regularly. Ex-mayor often chats with other users, gives business advice and expresses his opinion on current events.[https://www.facebook.com/chernovetskiy Публичная страница Леонида Черновецкого на facebook] Furthermore, Chernovetskiy periodically organizes various online contests for generating ideas to resolve crisis in Ukraine. Authors of the best ideas receive solid cash rewards from the ex-mayor.[http://obozrevatel.com/politics/96837-chernovetskij-obyavil-novyij-konkurs-s-prizovyim-fondom-3000-dollarov.htm Обозреватель. Черновецкий объявил новый конкурс с призовым фондом 3000 долларов] Chernoverskiy did not participate in the [[2014 Ukrainian parliamentary election]].{{uk icon}} [http://www.cvk.gov.ua/pls/vnd2014/WP401E?pt001f01=910&lit=67¤t_row=31 Alphabetical Index of candidates in 2014 Ukrainian parliamentary election], [[Central Election Commission of Ukraine]]. Georgia is my destiny!”.{{Cite web|url=http://www.georgianjournal.ge/politics/31938-georgia-is-my-destiny-kyivs-ex-mayor-extraordinaire-sets-his-sights-on-georgian-politics.html|title="Georgia is my destiny!" - Kyiv's ex-Mayor Extraordinaire sets his sights on Georgian Politics|last=Author|first=No|website=GeorgianJournal|access-date=2017-03-28}}{{Cite web|url=http://journal-neo.org/2016/01/08/does-leonid-chernovetskyi-have-a-hidden-agenda-in-georgia/|title=Does Leonid Chernovetskyi have a hidden agenda in Georgia? {{!}} New Eastern Outlook|access-date=2017-03-28}} ==Klychko - Chernovetsky stand-off== On February 6, 2009, the [[Vitaliy Klychko Bloc]] stated it will apply to the Verkhovna Rada, the [[Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine|Cabinet of Ministers]], the [[National Security and Defense Council]], and the Kiev prosecutor's office with a request to take into consideration the unlawfulness of Kiev Mayor Leonid Chernovetskyi actions and to call early mayoral elections in the city.[http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/179202.html Klychko Bloc In Kyiv Council Seeking Early Termination Of Chernovetskyi's Powers] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120919013830/http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/179202.html |date=2012-09-19 }}, [[Ukrainian News Agency]] (February 6, 2009) Earlier On December 12, 2008 [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]] [[Yulia Tymoshenko]] also hinted that new early mayoral elections should be held again in Kiev.[http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/168755.html Tymoshenko Confident That Early Mayoral Elections Will Be Repeated In Kyiv] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090820095217/http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/168755.html |date=2009-08-20 }}, [[Ukrainian News Agency]] (December 12, 2008) This was based on Tymoshenko's disapprove of the handling of Chernovetskyi of the local energy crises of December 2008 when the [[Kyivenergo]] utility company began cutting the supply of hot water to about 5,000 homes in Kiev because of the Kiev municipal administration's failure to compensate the company for the difference between the tariffs charged by Kyivenerho and the actual cost of its services. Tymoshenko accuses Leonid Chernovetskyi of using money from the municipal budget to finance his election campaign (and so there were insufficient funds to pay Kyivenerho).[http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/168745.html Cabinet Of Ministers To Consider Problems Arising In Kyiv] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090820095255/http://www.ukranews.com/eng/article/168745.html |date=2009-08-20 }}, [[Ukrainian News Agency]] (December 12, 2008) In May 2008, preliminary results showed Leonid Chernovetsky as clear leader ahead of Aleksandr Turchinov, a member of Ukraine Prime Minister Yulia Timoshenko’s Bloc and Vitaly Klychko.{{Cite web|url = https://www.rt.com/news/boxer-klitschko-knocked-out-in-mayor-fight/|title = Boxer Klitschko knocked out in mayor fight|website = RT International|language = en-EN|access-date = 2016-03-02}} Chernovetskyi had become unpopular among the residents of Kiev.[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/city/detail/62883/ Poll: 80 percent of Kyivans want mayor to resign], [[Kyiv Post]] (26 March 2009) On March 13, 2009 a Verkhovna Rada temporary commission on the issues of investigating violations of legislation by the officials of the Kiev city state administration and the Kiev city council came to the conclusion that it was necessary to examine the mental and physical state of Chernovetskyi, however, the procedure could be performed against his will only under a court ruling.[http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/9862/ Rada investigating commission considers it necessary to examine mental and physical state of Kyiv mayor], [[Interfax|Interfax-Ukraine]] (13 March 2009) in May 2009, Klychko threatened to sue Chernovetsky for claims he demanded two hectares of land on which to erect a boxing club.{{Cite web|url = http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/14682.html|title = Klychko to sue Chernovetsky for claims he demanded land plot in Kyiv|website = Interfax-Ukraine|access-date = 2016-03-02}} In 2011, the feud continued with Klychko again with allegations that Chernovetsky was responsible for the theft of 70 billion hryvni. Chernovetsy responded with intent to counter sue.{{Cite web|url = http://www.pravdareport.com/world/ussr/31-10-2011/119472-Vitali_Klitschko-0/|title = Vitali Klitschko to knock out all Ukrainian politicians|website = PravdaReport|access-date = 2016-03-02}} ;Yanukovych presidency Chernovetskyi announced in March 2009 he would participate in the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2010]].[http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/10852/ Chernovetskyi plans to run for president of Ukraine], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (26 March 2009) But did not do so. A March 2010 poll indicated that a large majority of Kiev residents (more than 89%) were unhappy with his work and would like the mayor to resign without delays (80%). On November 15, 2010 [[President of Ukraine|President]] [[Viktor Yanukovych]] dismissed Leonid Chernovetskyi from the post of Head of the Kiev's State Administration and appointed [[Oleksandr Popov]] to this post.[http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-406655.html Yanukovych dismissed Chernovetskyi], [[UNIAN]] (November 16, 2010) Popov is seen as Chernovetsky's replacement since he was not elected but appointed by President Viktor Yanukovich. The appointment was made possible by the [[Ukrainian parliament|Ukraine's national parliament]] which had amended the law on “the capital of Ukraine – [[hero city]] of Kiev” on September 7, 2010 making it possible for the President to appoint the chairman of the city administration at his discretion (before the amendments the elected Kiev mayor was automatically appointed head of the city administration). Another presidential decree relieved Chernovitsky of the office "head of the Kiev State Administration", while still preserving the post of Kiev mayor.[http://www.docstoc.com/docs/67848764/See-in-Content-Political-Risk Political Risks and Political Stability in Ukraine], [[UCIPR]] (October 2010) Popov stated early 2011 "we've definitely limited the activity of the [[Kiev city council|city council]] and the mayor to some extent". In November 2010 [[Ukrainian Prime Minister|Prime Minister]] [[Mykola Azarov]] compared Chernovetsky to the [[Elizabeth II|Queen of England]], saying he had a title but no official decision-making role.[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/nation/detail/93068/ #14 Richest: Leonid Chernovetsky, 59], [[Kyiv Post]] (December 17, 2010) The [[Azarov Government]] then opened several investigations into the allegedly illegal sale of city land and property by Chernovetsky's top officials and then sales of those lands to friends and their companies. By then Chernovetsky was not to be seen in Kiev and rumors appeared he was in "quasi-retirement" in [[Switzerland]], was seeking [[political asylum]] in [[Israel]] or that he had secretly tendered his resignation. In a pressconference on January 28, 2011 [[Prime Minister of Ukraine|Prime Minister]] [[Mykola Azarov|Azarov]] asked Popov “to find by all means” Chernovetsky "to bring him back to the work". According to [[UNIAN]] Azarov "could not suppress a laugh" when asked about Chernovetsky.[http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-418372.html Azarov asks “to find Chernovetskyi by all means”], [[UNIAN]] (January 28, 2011) Popov has stated he last met with the mayor toward the end of 2010. Chernovetsky's spokeswoman Marta Hrymska told ''[[The Associated Press]]'' on 8 February 2011 in a [[phone text message]] that the mayor resumed duties after a vacation in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]. Commentators suggested that by failing to fulfill his duties, Chernovetsky was trying to force President Yanukovich to stop the investigations into his close aides and that Yanukovych was reluctant to see Chernovetsky go just yet and share power with a new mayor, because his protégé Popov, was unlikely to get elected.{{cite news| url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/41475750/ns/world_news-europe/t/missing-mayor-cosmos-back-work-maybe/| title=Missing Kiev mayor back to work - maybe| newspaper=msnbc.com| date=February 8, 2011| first=Maria| last=Danilova}} On February 24, 2011 Chernovetskyi did attend a meeting of the [[Kiev City Council]].[http://photo.unian.net/eng/themes/21354 Events by themes: Chernovetsky opened sitting of Kiev city council], [[UNIAN]] (February 24, 2011) On 3 August 2011 it was reported that Chernovetskyi has secretly left Ukraine and moved to Israel. According to [[Agence France Press]], he was discovered by a crew of Ukrainian television channel 1+1 in an apartment in Tel Aviv. In a brief statement, Chernovetskyi, who was surprised they had found him, called it "an unofficial holiday".{{cite news| url=https://news.yahoo.com/kievs-vanishing-mayor-reappears-israel-101545858.html| title=Kiev's vanishing mayor 'reappears in Israel'| newspaper=AFP }} It had been reported earlier, that he has held Israeli citizenship since 1994, having run for president and for Kiev mayor while holding dual Israeli and Ukrainian citizenships in violation of Ukrainian law, which does not allow its citizens to hold dual citizenship.{{cite news| url=http://www.kyivpost.com/news/city/detail/110006/| title= Ukraine's Justice Ministry says it knows nothing about Chernovetsky's second citizenship| newspaper=Kyiv Post| date=3 August 2011}} In February 2012 Chernovetskyi stated he will not run for re-election.[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/city/detail/122543/ Chernovetsky says he will no longer run for Kyiv mayor], [[Kyiv Post]] (16 February 2012) Chernovetsky tendered his resignation on 1 June 2012.[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/kyiv/hereha-sends-petition-to-parliament-on-holding-of--310160.html Hereha sends petition to parliament on holding of early mayoral election in Kyiv], [[Kyiv Post]] (19 July 2012) The City Council accepted the early termination of office on 12 July 2012. The City Council decided the same day that [[Halyna Hereha]] would temporarily act as the mayor of the capital city. Kiev then did not have an elected mayor until mayor [[Vitali Klitschko]] was sworn in on 5 June 2014.[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/208052.html Vitali Klitschko sworn in as Kiev mayor], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (5 June 2014)

{{Infobox company | name = Looker | logo = Looker.png | type = [[Privately held company]] | foundation = [[Santa Cruz, California]] (2012) | key_people = {{unbulleted list | Lloyd Tabb {{small|(Founder, [[Chief technology officer|CTO]])}} | Ben Porterfield {{small|(Co-Founder & VP Engineering)}} | Frank Bien {{small|([[CEO]])}} | Marc Randolph {{small|(Director)}} }} | location_city = Santa Cruz, California | location_country = U.S. | industry = [[Computer software]], [[Enterprise Software]] | num_employees = 500 (July 2018) | homepage = [http://www.looker.com looker.com] }}
'''Looker Data Sciences''' (doing business as '''Looker''') is an American [[computer software]] company headquartered in [[Santa Cruz, California]]. Looker markets a [[data exploration]] and discovery [[business intelligence]] platform.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looker.com/ |title=Looker |publisher=Looker |date= |accessdate=2015-01-11}}</ref>
== History == The company was founded in Santa Cruz, California in January, 2012 by Lloyd Tabb and Ben Porterfield. The product grew out of Tabb's experience building software at companies like [[Netscape]], [[LiveOps]], and Luminate before founding Looker.
Looker makes use of a simple modeling language called LookML that lets data teams define the relationships in their database so business users can explore, save, and download data without needing to know the [[SQL]] query language. The product was the first commercially available [[business intelligence]] platform built for and aimed at scalable or [[Massively parallel (computing)|massively parallel]] [[relational database management systems]] like [[Amazon Redshift]], Google [[BigQuery]], HP [[Vertica]], [[Netezza]], and [[Teradata]].
On August 13, 2013, Looker announced a Series A round of funding from [[Redpoint Ventures]], First Round Capital, and PivotNorth Capital, raising more than $18M.<ref name="looker_series_a">{{cite web |url=http://pando.com/2013/08/13/looker-announces-16m-series-a-and-a-savvy-new-ceo-rise-above-stodgy-old-bi-solutions/ |title=Looker announces a $16M Series A and a savvy new CEO to rise above stodgy old BI solutions |author=Carney, Michael |date=August 13, 2013 |accessdate=January 14, 2015 |publisher=PandoDaily}}</ref> Prior to the Series A round, Looker raised $2M in a seed round from [[First Round Capital]] and [[PivotNorth Capital]].<ref name="looker_series_a"/> On March 11, 2015 Looker raised $30M in series B funding.<ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.forbes.com/sites/benkepes/2015/03/11/looker-raises-30m-to-further-its-analytics-aims/ |title= Looker Raises $30M To Further Its Analytics Aims |author= Ben Kepes |work= Forbes |date= March 11, 2015 |access-date= August 12, 2016 }}</ref> In July, 2015, Jen Grant joined as chief marketing officer, and the company estimated it has 140 employees.<ref>{{Cite web |title= Fast-growing data analytics company Looker hires former Box exec Jen Grant |author= Dylan Tweney |date= July 1, 2015 |work= Venture Beat |access-date = August 12, 2016 }}</ref> On January 14, 2016 Looker raised $48M in series C funding from [[Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers|Kleiner Perkins Claufield & Byers]].<ref>{{Cite web |title = Looker Series C Funding from Kleiner Perkins |work= Press release |publisher= Looker Data Sciences|url = http://www.looker.com/news/press/looker-secures-48-million-series-c-funding-from-kleiner-perkins |date= January 14, 2016 |access-date = August 12, 2016 }}</ref> At that time, the company estimated 450 customers, including [[Jet.com]].<ref>{{Cite web |title= Data analytics startup Looker raises $48 million, led by Kleiner Perkins |work= Venture Beat |author= Jordan Novet |date= January 14, 2016 |access-date = August 12, 2016 }}</ref> On March 30th, 2017 Looker raised $81.5M in series D funding led by Capital G. On June 21st, 2016 Looker celebrated the release of "Winning With Data," a book coauthored by Looker CEO, Frank Bien and Redpoint Partner, Tomasz Tunguz.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.santacruztechbeat.com/2016/08/19/audio-tomasz-tunguz-frank-bien-discuss-winning-data-book/|title=Audio: Tomasz Tunguz & Frank Bien discuss Winning with Data book|last=Isenberg|first=Sara|date=2016-08-20|website=Santa Cruz Tech Beat|access-date=2016-08-20}}</ref>

'''Marcy Blum''' is an American author, event planner and owner of Marcy Blum Associates in [[New York City]].
== Education == Blum is a graduate of [[The Culinary Institute of America]] and began her career in the restaurant business, later creating a segue into the then developing field of [[event planning]].<ref name=nys1>Swerdloff, Alexis ''[http://www.nysun.com/article/7482?page_no=1 What Do Padma Lakshmi and Kyra Sedgwick Have in Common? Their Wedding Planner,] [[New York Sun]]'', January 11, 2005</ref> In 1986<ref>Mallozzi, Vincent M.; Gettleman, Jeffrey ''[https://www.nytimes.com/2007/06/24/fashion/24planner.html?pagewanted=1&ref=fashion Taming the Runaway Wedding Planner,] [[The New York Times]]'', June 24, 2007</ref> she became one of the first in the industry to develop the vocation into a successful career<ref name="nys1"/>
== Career == Blum has been a guest on the ''[[CBS Morning Show]]'', ''[[Today (NBC program)|The Today Show]]'', ''[[Live with Regis and Kelly]]'', ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' and ''[[The Nate Berkus Show]].''{{citation needed|date=January 2014}}<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://weddingmarketnews.com/marcy_blum/|title=Interview with Wedding Planner Marcy Blum – Wedding Market|website=weddingmarketnews.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref>
Among her clients are [[Billy Joel]] and [[Katie Lee Joel]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6874808/jimmy-iovine-liberty-ross-wedding-gift-picks|title=Jimmy Iovine & Liberty Ross Wedding Gift Picks - Billboard|author=|date=|work=Billboard}}</ref> [[Kevin Bacon]] and [[Kyra Sedgwick]], [[Salman Rushdie]] and [[Padma Lakshmi]], [[Colin Hanks]] and Samantha Bryant, [[LeBron James|Lebron James]] and Savannah James,<ref name="Williams">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/15/fashion/jennifer-aniston-justin-theroux-how-celebrities-keep-their-weddings-a-secret.html|title=How Celebrities Keep Their Weddings a Secret|last=Williams|first=Alex|date=2015-08-15|newspaper=The New York Times|issn=0362-4331|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> [[George Soros]] and Tomiko Soros,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-soros-wedding-idUSBRE98J0XZ20130922|title=Billionaire Soros weds consultant in third marriage|date=2013-09-22|newspaper=Reuters|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> The [[Rockefeller family]], [[Nate Berkus]] and [[Jeremiah Brent]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.people.com/article/nate-berkus-marries-jeremiah-brent|title=Nate Berkus Marries Jeremiah Brent|website=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> and [[Andre Iguodala]] and Christina Iguodala.<ref name="nys1"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pagesix.com/2015/08/10/nba-finals-mvp-ties-the-knot/|title=NBA Finals MVP ties the knot|last=Smith|first=Emily|website=Page Six|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20773192,00.html|title=Couple Injured in Boston Marathon Bombing to Marry in Dream Wedding|website=people.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> She was also the planner of [[The Knot Inc.|The Knot]]'s "Dream Wedding" in 2014 of Boston Marathon bombing survivors, Rebekah Gregory and Pete DiMartino.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20803009,00.html|title=Couple Injured in Boston Marathon Bombing Weds|website=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> ''[[New York magazine|New York]]'' magazine described Blum as a "desired wedding planner to the wealthy and famous."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/thecut/2014/06/list-of-utterly-impractical-celebrity-weddings.html|title=A List of Utterly Impractical Celebrity Weddings -- The Cut|author=|date=|work=The Cut}}</ref>
''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue Magazine]]'' named Blum one of the top wedding planners in the world by,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.vogue.com/13405286/best-wedding-planners-list-database-around-the-world/|title=''Vogue''{{'}}s Ultimate Wedding Planner Master List|last=Rees|first=Samantha|website=Vogue|language=en-US|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.harpersbazaar.com/wedding/planning/g6965/best-wedding-planners/|title=Bazaar's Little Black Book: The Top Wedding Planners in the U.S.|date=2016-03-16|website=Harper's Bazaar|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> and [[Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia|Martha Stewart Weddings]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.marthastewartweddings.com/381413/top-wedding-planners#381269|title=64 Top Wedding Planners|website=Martha Stewart Weddings|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref>
Blum has written and contributed to many articles, including ''[[The New York Times]]'',<ref name="Williams"/> ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' magazine,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nymag.com/nymag/features/23785/index1.html|title=The High-End Party: Gilded to Perfection|website=NYMag.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> The Knot,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theknot.com/content/3-expert-planning-tips-from-celeb-wedding-stylist-marcy-blum|title=3 Expert Planning Tips from Celeb Wedding Stylist Marcy Blum|website=theknot.com|access-date=2016-03-19}}</ref> ''[[Brides (magazine)|Brides]]'' magazine, ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', ''Modern Bride'', ''[[InStyle]]'', and ''[[Town & Country (magazine)|Town & Country]]''.
She coauthored, with Laura Kaiser, two books, ''Wedding Planning for Dummies'' and ''Wedding Kit for Dummies''.<ref name="nys1" />
==Personal== Marcy is the sister of American author and journalist [[Howard Blum]].

}} Born in 1970 in Morocco, Mohamed Hassan BENSALAH is the chairman and the CEO of the moroccan group HOLMARCOM.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mohamed Hassan BENSALAH|url=http://www.leconomiste.com/article/mohamed-hassan-bensalah-au-club-de-l-economistebr-la-valeur-du-groupe-ete-multipliee-par-30}}</ref>
==Studies and degrees== After a baccalaureate type B in the French school, Mohamed Hassan BENSALAH went to France for higher studies where he obtained a Master in management and finance at Sorbonne university and l’Ecole des Cadres de Paris.<ref>{{cite news|title=Studies and degrees|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/206473/archives-thematique/mohamed-hassan-bensalah/|agency=Holmarcom}}</ref>
==Professional career== Mohamed Hassan BENSALAH succeeded in 1993 to his late father and founder of Holmarcom GROUP as a chairman and CEO.. He is also : * President of the Moroccan Federation of Insurance and Reinsurance Companies (FMSAR)<ref>{{cite news| title=President of the Moroccan Federation of Insurance and Reinsurance Companies;|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=23267280&privcapId=38010476}}</ref> * Member of the Board of Directors of the General Confederation of Enterprises of Morocco (CGEM), the Casablanca Finance City and the Stock Exchange of Casablanca <ref>{{cite news|title=Member of the Board of Directors of the Mohammed VI Foundation for the Protection of the Environment, Mohammed V Foundation for Solidarity and Alawite Foundation for Sustainable Human Development|url=http://www.challenge.ma/hassan-bensalah-elu-pour-un-4eme-mandat-a-la-tete-de-la-fmsar-40658/}}</ref> * Member of the Board of Directors of BMCI bank (BNP Paribas Group), CIH bank (CDG Group), the Moroccan Inter-Professional Retirement Fund (CIMR), the incorporated company MUTANDIS.<ref>{{cite news|title=Member of the Board of Directors of BMCI bank (BNP Paribas Group), CIH bank (CDG Group), the Moroccan Inter-Professional Retirement Fund (CIMR), the incorporated company MUTANDIS|url=http://www.holmarcom.ma/en/the-group/corporate-governance/executive-committee}}</ref>
==Engagements== * Member of the Board of Directors of Mohammed VI Foundation for the Protection of the Environment, Mohammed V Foundation for Solidarity and Alaouite Foundation for Sustainable Human Development<ref name="Board of Directors FM6E">{{cite web|title=Board of Directors FM6E; |url=http://www.fm6e.org/images/stories/v2/liste_ca21_en.pdf}}</ref> * Member of the Economic, Social and Environmental Council
He was decorated as Knight of the Order of the Throne of Morocco (Wissam Al Arch) by His Majesty King Mohammed VI, in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|title=Engagements |url=http://www.holmarcom.ma/le-groupe/instances-de-gouvernance/capital-humain}}</ref>

{{About|the aviator Murat Öztürk|the football coach|Murat Öztürk}} {{Infobox aviator |name = Murat Öztürk |image = |image_size = 200px |alt = |caption = |full_name = |birth_date = 1953 |birth_place = [[Konya]], Turkey |death_date = {{Death year and age|2013|1953}} |death_place = [[Adana]], Turkey |death_cause = Aviation accident |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LATITUDE|LONGITUDE|type:landmark}} --> |monuments = |nationality = [[Turkey]] |spouse = |relatives = |first_race = |racing_best = |racing_aircraft = |website = }}
'''Murat Öztürk''' (1953 in Konya – 19 May 2013 in Adana) was a [[Turkey|Turkish]] professional [[aerobatics]] [[pilot (aircraft)|pilot]] and former [[camera operator]].
==Early life== Murat Öztürk was born 1953 in [[Konya]]. He worked as a news camera operator at the state-run television channel of [[Turkish Radio and Television Corporation]] (TRT). His professional life changed in 1985 when he was sent to Samandıra Airfield, Istanbul for a news footage on [[ultralight aviation]]. Afterwards, he took to flying ultralight aircraft, and acquired both pilot and instructor licenses.<ref name="h">{{cite news |url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/gundem/23320701.asp |newspaper=Hürriyet |title=Adana'da gösteri uçağı düştü |authors=Karaçalı Fatih & Çilem Anıtkan |date=2013-05-19 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-05-19 }}</ref>
==Aviator== With a friend, Öztürk purchased an agricultural plot on the bank of [[Lake Büyükçekmece]] to convert it into an earthen sports airfield for his flight exercises. He soon left his post as a cameraman, and, with the financial support of a businessman, built an asphalt-covered airfield with hangars that became known as [[Istanbul Hezarfen Airfield]] serving [[general aviation]].<ref name="h"/>
He co-founded the aviation company "Top Air", one of Turkey's first private flight training schools, which educated hundreds of professional and amateur pilots. Not long ago, he completely took over Top Air. His daughter Pelin Öztürk acquired her pilot license in 2011, and is working as a pilot-instructor in her father's flight school.<ref name="h"/>
Combining his photography experience with flying, Murat Öztürk became Turkey's first ever [[aerial photography|aerial photogtapher]], and was awarded for his aerial imagery.<ref name="h"/>
==Aerobatic pilot== In 2010, he became interested in [[aerobatics]]. In 2012, Öztürk crashed with his [[Pitts Special]] [[aerobatic]] [[biplane]] at Hezarfen Airfield. After recovering from his injuries, he returned to flying.<ref name="h"/>
Since February 2013, Öztürk used to display aerobatics with his two-seat [[Pitts Special#Variants|Pitts Special S-2B]], registration TC-AYT, which he had purchased shortly before.<ref name="h"/> After signing a sponsorship deal with an [[energy drink]] company in 2013, he performed his first aerobatic show above [[Maiden's Tower]] at [[Bosphorus]] on 28 April 2013.<ref name="h"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sabah.com.tr/Yasam/2013/04/29/kiz-kulesinde-muhtesem-gosteri |newspaper=[[Sabah (newspaper)|Sabah]] |title=Kız Kulesi'nde muhteşem gösteri |author=Er, Mesut |date=2013-04-29 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-05-19 }}</ref> He then took part at an air show of the [[Turkish Stars]] and Solo Türk held on 12 May 2013 at Hezarfen Airfield.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.f5haber.com/star/hezarfen-den-solo-turk-ve-turk-yildizlari-gecti-haberi-3903214/ |newspaper=F5 Haber |title=Hezarfen'den Solo Türk ve Türk Yıldızları geçti |date=2013-05-12 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-05-19 }}</ref>
To join an air show at the 2nd International Air Games Festival ({{lang-tr|Uluslararası Hava Oyunları Festivali}}) in [[Adana]], he took off from Istanbul Hezarfen Airfield on 15 May 2013. After a refueling stop at Eskişehir İnönü Airfield he flew to Ankara, where he visited the [[Directorate General of Civil Aviation (Turkey)|Directorate General of Civil Aviation]]. Öztürk arrived in Adana on 16 May, flying via [[Cappadocia]] in [[Nevşehir Province]]. In Adana, he performed a number of aerobatic shows over the city on 18 and 19 May in conjunction with the celebrations of the [[Commemoration of Atatürk, Youth and Sports Day]].<ref name="h"/>
==Death== He died on 19 May 2013, when his plane crashed into the ground and caught fire while performing a diving manoeuvre during the air show in Adana.<ref name="h"/> His body was taken to Istanbul, where he was buried at the [[Eyüp Cemetery]]. He is survived by his wife Nilgün and daughter Pelin.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sabah.com.tr/Yasam/2013/05/21/murat-ozturk-son-yolculuguna-ugurlandi |newspaper=[[Sabah (newspaper)|Sabah]] |title=Murat Öztürk son yolculuğuna uğurlandı |date=2013-05-21 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-05-21 }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

'''Orion Bus Industries Orion-Ikarus 286''' or commonly known as the '''Orion III''' was a [[Hungarian People's Republic|Hungarian]]-built and Canada-assembled articulated bus, sold by [[Orion Bus Industries]] to the Canada market and similar to [[Crown-Ikarus 286]] in the United States.
==Production== Shell and partial built shells were sent from [[Ikarus (Hungarian company)|Ikarus Body and Coach Works]] in [[Hungary]] and finally assembly (doors, windows and seats) at Orion Bus's plant in [[Mississauga, Ontario]] from 1985 to 1989.
==Operators== Four transit agencies used the 286, but only 3 had them on full roster:
* [[Toronto Transit Commission]] of [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] operated 90 buses from late 1987 to 2003 (retirement began in 1997-1998); some sold to [[OC Transpo]] * [[OC Transpo]] of [[Ottawa, Ontario]] operated 189 buses from 1985 to 2003; acquired some TTC buses in the late 1990s as well as from St. Catherines (for parts) * [[St. Catharines Transit]] Ex Orion III Demo operated one bus from the 1980s to the early 1990s and later sold to [[OC Transpo]] as a Parts bus.
[[Transit Windsor]] operated a demo vehicle only (June 1985) for tunnel service along the [[Detroit–Windsor Tunnel]].

[[Niklas Herlin]] | relations = | website = }} '''Pekka Aksel Herlin''' (15 July 1932 – 4 April 2003) was a Finnish businessman, the president of the elevator and escalator maker [[Kone]] from 1964. In 1954, Pekka Herlin joined Kone, and succeeded [[Heikki H. Herlin|his father]] as president in 1964, and started planning a new elevator factory in [[Hyvinkää]] to replace the "cramped and inefficient" Helsinki plant.{{cite web|url=http://www.kone.com/en/company/history/|title=History|publisher=}} When he died in 2003, and it was discovered that he had rewritten his will in 1999, leaving most of the elevator and escalator maker [[Kone]] to his son [[Antti Herlin]]. [[Ilkka Herlin]] and his siblings Ilona and Niklas were unhappy about not being informed, and the dispute finally ended in 2005. The Kone company was split, with Antti receiving a majority stake in its core elevator business. Ilkka and his siblings received a majority of [[Cargotec]] and a minority stake in the new Kone company. All four siblings became billionaires.{{cite web|title=The World's Billionaires: Ilkka Herlin|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/ilkka-herlin/|website=Forbes|accessdate=10 February 2017}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Herlin, Pekka Aksel}} [[Category:1932 births]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] [[Category:Finnish businesspeople]] [[Category:Herlin family|Pekka]]
